Class SimpleList

  • java.lang.Object
    • SimpleList

  • public class SimpleList
extends java.lang.Object
    Translating a simple linked list from C++ to Java The overall purpose of the lab is to translate the differences between C++ and Java in terms of linked lists. Although there is a LinkedList object that already exists in Java, this code replicates the object in terms of C++.
    Since:
    January 27, 2016

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  SimpleList.Node 

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private SimpleList.Node head
      A node class which contains the data and the next node address
      private int sizeM
      The total size of the linked list

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SimpleList()
      Constructs a LinkedList object without any specified values.

    • Field Detail

      • head

        private SimpleList.Node head
        A node class which contains the data and the next node address

      • sizeM

        private int sizeM
        The total size of the linked list

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleList

        public SimpleList()
        Constructs a LinkedList object without any specified values. Automatically sets the size to be 0 and the head to be a null Node/

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public int get(int n)
        Gets the data from the specified Node location
        Parameters:
        n - the location of the node

      • set

        public void set(int n,
       int v)
        Sets the data stored inside a specified Node
        Parameters:
        n - the location of the node
        v - the data to be stored in the node

      • push_back

        public void push_back(int item)
        Adds a new node to the end of the linked list. If the linked list is empty then the program will add the node to the head.
        Parameters:
        item - the data to be stored in the node

      • push_front

        public void push_front(int item)
        Adds a new node to the start of the linked list and assigns the head to the new node
        Parameters:
        item - the data to be stored in the node

      • insert

        public void insert(int itemA,
          int n)
        Inserts a node at a specified location in the linked list. If the location specified is at the start of the linked list, then the function will call push_front. If the location is at the end, the push_back will be called.
        Parameters:
        itemA - the data to be stored in the node
        n - the location of the node

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Completely deletes the entire Linked List. This is done by setting each node to null

      • remove

        public void remove(int n)
        Removes a node from the specified location
        Parameters:
        n - the location of the node to be removed

      • size

        public int size()
        Returns the size of the Linked List

      • print

        public static void print(SimpleList list)
        Prints the Linked List
        Parameters:
        list - the Linked List to be printed

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
